CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Speediness of review)
JUDGES: Ján Šikuta;Johannes Silvis;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant ’s identity has been the subject of controversy at the national level . In his submission to the ORG he referred to himself as mentioned above ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) , and indicated his year of birth as DATE .

It observed , inter alia , that there had been unjustified delay in dealing with the applicant ’s request at the first level of jurisdiction , which could potentially serve as a ground for calling the President of its ORG to account , but which in itself did not constitute a reason for releasing the applicant .

Referring to its previous judgments in cases nos . III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , I. ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL and III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG observed that the “ speediness ” requirement would usually not be deemed to have been respected if the length of the proceedings in question amounted to DATE , as opposed to DATE ; if the proceedings lasted DATE at a single level of jurisdiction ; or if there had been a period of judicial inactivity amounting to DATE .
